action.action-desc: Mr. Harper (for himself and Mr. Owens) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce
Additional sponsors: Mr. Kelly, Mr. Olson, Mr. Schrader, and Mr. Kinzinger of Illinois
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic

form.official-title: To repeal an obsolete provision in title 49, United States Code, requiring motor vehicle insurance cost reporting.

section.text: Subsection (c) of section 32302 of title 49, United States Code, is repealed, and any regulations promulgated under such subsection shall have no force or effect.
Subsection (c) of section 32302 of title 49, United States Code, is repealed, and any regulations promulgated under such subsection shall have no force or effect.

section.header: Determination regarding provision of damage susceptibility information to consumers

subsection.text: Section 32302(b) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following: The Secretary, after providing an opportunity for public comment, shall study and report to Congress the most useful data, format, and method for providing simple and understandable damage susceptibility information to consumers..

The Secretary of Transportation shall carry out the last sentence of section 32302(b) of title 49, United States Code, as added by subsection (a), not later than the date that is 2 years after the date of the enactment of this Act.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
